aforisms.words: Your next step is simple. You are the first domino.
aforisms.author: Gary Keller

aforisms.words: Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.
aforisms.author: George Washington

aforisms.words: When you are totally at peace with yourself, nothing can shake you.
aforisms.author: Deepam Chaterjee

aforisms.words: People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.
aforisms.author: Dale Carnegie

aforisms.words: We learn by pushing ourselves and finding what really lies at the outer reaches of our abilities.
aforisms.author: Josh Waitzkin

aforisms.words: Life is love and love is life.
aforisms.author: Elvis Presley

aforisms.words: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
aforisms.author: T.S. Eliot

aforisms.words: Sometimes, the only way to evolve is to open ourselves fully.
aforisms.author: Kamal Ravikant

aforisms.words: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
aforisms.author: Beverly Sills

aforisms.words: Enjoy every minute of life. Never second-guess life.
aforisms.author: Michael Jordan

aforisms.words: Focused, hard work is the real key to success.
aforisms.author: John Carmack

aforisms.words: The human mind defines things in relation to one another - without light the notion of darkness would be unintelligible.
aforisms.author: Josh Waitzkin

aforisms.words: To succeed takes more than the desire to win. It also takes the acceptance that we could fail.
aforisms.author: Simon Sinek

aforisms.words: When something comes from within, when it is a part of you, you have no choice but to live it, to express it.
aforisms.author: Kamal Ravikant

aforisms.words: Accept responsibility for your life. Know that it is you who will get you where you want to go, no one else.
aforisms.author: Les Brown

aforisms.words: No problem can be solved from the same level of consciousness that created it.
aforisms.author: Albert Einstein

aforisms.words: I must also have a dark side if I am to be whole.
aforisms.author: Carl Jung

aforisms.words: All that a man achieves and all that he fails to achieve is the direct result of his own thoughts.
aforisms.author: James Allen

aforisms.words: The wisest men follow their own direction.
aforisms.author: Euripides

aforisms.words: Rest and be kind, you don't have to prove anything.
aforisms.author: Jack Kerouac

aforisms.words: Never say never, because limits, like fears, are often just an illusion.
aforisms.author: Michael Jordan

aforisms.words: There is no significance in life without struggle.
aforisms.author: Lolly Daskal

aforisms.words: The world is open for play, everything and everybody is mockable in a wonderful way.
aforisms.author: Robin Williams

aforisms.words: The first rule of handling conflict is don't hang around people who are constantly engaging in conflict.
aforisms.author: Naval Ravikant

aforisms.words: Superstars think like superstars long before the fans or the press anoint them.
aforisms.author: John Eliot

aforisms.words: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
aforisms.author: Mark Twain

aforisms.words: Your hardest times often lead to the greatest moments of your life. Keep going. Tough situations build strong people in the end.
aforisms.author: Roy T. Bennett

aforisms.words: The highest form of ignorance is when you reject something you don't know anything about.
aforisms.author: Wayne Dyer

aforisms.words: The whole problem with the world is the fools and fanatics are always so sure of themselves, and wiser people are full of doubts.
aforisms.author: George Bernard Shaw

aforisms.words: To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.
aforisms.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

aforisms.words: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
aforisms.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

aforisms.words: The quality of your life is the quality of your relationships.
aforisms.author: Tony Robbins

aforisms.words: Your past does not equal your future.
aforisms.author: Tony Robbins

aforisms.words: Nothing is too high for a man to reach, but he must climb with care and confidence
aforisms.author: Hans Christian Andersen

aforisms.words: Acknowledging the good that you already have in your life is the foundation for all abundance.
aforisms.author: Eckhart Tolle

aforisms.words: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
aforisms.author: Oscar Wilde

aforisms.words: Too much sanity may be madness and the maddest of all, to see life as it is and not as it should be.
aforisms.author: Miguel de Cervantes

aforisms.words: You get paid in direct proportion to the difficulty of problems you solve.
aforisms.author: Elon Musk

aforisms.words: No one can hurt you without your consent.
aforisms.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

aforisms.words: If you focus on results and finding shortcuts, you'll get impatient. If you focus on the process and doing the right thing, you'll be unstoppable.
aforisms.author: Maxime Lagace

aforisms.words: To every action there is always opposed an equal reaction.
aforisms.author: Isaac Newton

aforisms.words: Do not look for a sanctuary in anyone except your self.
aforisms.author: Buddha

aforisms.words: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.
aforisms.author: Lao Tzu

aforisms.words: You are the average of the five people you spend the most time with.
aforisms.author: Jim Rohn

aforisms.words: People who belittle people, will be LITTLE people, and will accomplish very Little
aforisms.author: Norman Vincent Peale

aforisms.words: For things to change, you have to change.
aforisms.author: Jim Rohn

aforisms.words: To a mind that is still, the entire universe surrenders.
aforisms.author: Zhuangzi

aforisms.words: If you pray for rain, be prepared to deal with some mud.
aforisms.author: Mary Engelbreit

aforisms.words: Make yourself so useful to other people, that they think you are irreplaceable.
aforisms.author: Og Mandino

aforisms.words: Your only obligation in any lifetime is to be true to yourself.
aforisms.author: Richard Bach

aforisms.words: Most people achieved their greatest success one step beyond what looked like their greatest failure.
aforisms.author: Brian Tracy

aforisms.words: The way of success is the way of continuous pursuit of knowledge.
aforisms.author: Napoleon Hill

aforisms.words: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
aforisms.author: Lao Tzu

aforisms.words: Pleasure is always derived from something outside you, whereas joy arises from within.
aforisms.author: Eckhart Tolle

aforisms.words: You need a plan to build a house. To build a life, it is even more important to have a plan or goal.
aforisms.author: Zig Ziglar

aforisms.words: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
aforisms.author: Jim Rohn

aforisms.words: Most people do not really want freedom, because freedom involves responsibility, and most people are frightened of responsibility.
aforisms.author: Sigmund Freud

aforisms.words: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
aforisms.author: Epictetus

aforisms.words: Looking after my health today gives me a better hope for tomorrow.
aforisms.author: Anne Wilson Schaef

aforisms.words: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
aforisms.author: Thomas Jefferson

aforisms.words: Everybody by your side ain't on your side.
aforisms.author: Steve Harvey

aforisms.words: Life is not just the passing of time. Life is the collection of experiences and their intensity.
aforisms.author: Jim Rohn

aforisms.words: Always keep your eyes open. Keep watching. Because whatever you see can inspire you.
aforisms.author: Grace Coddington

aforisms.words: Every day do something that will inch you closer to a better tomorrow.
aforisms.author: Unknown

aforisms.words: The only way it gets better for you is when you get better. Better is not something you wish, it's something you become.
aforisms.author: Jim Rohn

aforisms.words: To live fully is to be always in no-man's-land, to experience each moment as completely new and fresh.
aforisms.author: Pema Chodron

aforisms.words: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
aforisms.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

aforisms.words: Intelligent people make many mistakes because they cannot believe the world is really as foolish as it is.
aforisms.author: Nicolas Chamfort

aforisms.words: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to us.
aforisms.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

aforisms.words: Men do not attract which they want but that which they are.
aforisms.author: James Allen

aforisms.words: What you resist, persists.
aforisms.author: Carl Jung

aforisms.words: Human beings believe just as they breathe - in order to survive.
aforisms.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

aforisms.words: Do all things with love.
aforisms.author: Og Mandino

aforisms.words: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
aforisms.author: Henry Ford

aforisms.words: If you put yourself in a position where you have to stretch outside your comfort zone, then you are forced to expand your consciousness.
aforisms.author: Unknown

aforisms.words: I put my heart and soul into my work, and I have lost my mind in the process.
aforisms.author: Vincent van Gogh

aforisms.words: Your greatest asset is your earning ability. Your greatest resource is your time.
aforisms.author: Brian Tracy

aforisms.words: You need to be doing fewer things for more effect instead of doing more things with side effects.
aforisms.author: Gary Keller

aforisms.words: The chief enemy of creativity is good sense.
aforisms.author: Pablo Picasso

aforisms.words: A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song.
aforisms.author: Chinese Proverb

aforisms.words: As you think, so shall you become.
aforisms.author: Bruce Lee

aforisms.words: It's always to soon to quit!
aforisms.author: Norman Vincent Peale

aforisms.words: It is best to begin at the beginning.
aforisms.author: Amelia Earhart

aforisms.words: Forgive those who have hurt you.
aforisms.author: Les Brown

aforisms.words: If you are going to achieve excellence in big things, you develop the habit in little matters.
aforisms.author: Colin Powell

aforisms.words: A golden cage is still just a cage.
aforisms.author: Anita Krizzan

aforisms.words: Wise people, even though all laws were abolished, would still lead the same life.
aforisms.author: Aristophanes

aforisms.words: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can't live long enough to make them all yourself.
aforisms.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

aforisms.words: Great leaders are almost always great simplifiers, who can cut through argument, debate and doubt, to offer a solution everybody can understand.
aforisms.author: Colin Powell

aforisms.words: You may delay, but time will not.
aforisms.author: Benjamin Franklin

aforisms.words: If you only knew the magnificence of the 3, 6, and 9, then you would have a key to the universe.
aforisms.author: Nikola Tesla

aforisms.words: If you have to be in a soap opera try not to be cast in the worst role.
aforisms.author: Judy Garland

aforisms.words: Success is good at any age, but the sooner you find it, the longer you will enjoy it.
aforisms.author: Napoleon Hill

aforisms.words: Beware of false knowledge, it is more dangerous than ignorance.
aforisms.author: George Bernard Shaw

aforisms.words: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
aforisms.author: Kahlil Gibran

aforisms.words: The first rule of handling conflict is don't hang around people who are constantly engaging in conflict.
aforisms.author: Naval Ravikant

aforisms.words: Happiness must be grown in one's own garden.
aforisms.author: Mary Engelbreit

aforisms.words: Fear is a natural reaction to moving closer to the truth.
aforisms.author: Pema Chodron

aforisms.words: Change is hardest at the beginning, messiest in the middle and best at the end.
aforisms.author: Robin Sharma

aforisms.words: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
aforisms.author: Charles Darwin

aforisms.words: It's easy to wish for health when you're sick.  When you're doing well, you need just as much vigilance.
aforisms.author: Kamal Ravikant

aforisms.words: I take the position that I'm always to some degree wrong, and the aspiration is to be less wrong.
aforisms.author: Elon Musk

aforisms.words: Don't be afraid of enemies who attack you. Be afraid of the friends who flatter you.
aforisms.author: Dale Carnegie

aforisms.words: If you want things to be different, perhaps the answer is to become different yourself.
aforisms.author: Norman Vincent Peale

aforisms.words: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.
aforisms.author: Earl Nightingale

aforisms.words: Get busy living, or get busy dying.
aforisms.author: Stephen King

aforisms.words: The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going.
aforisms.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

aforisms.words: Like it or not, this moment is all we really have to work with.
aforisms.author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

aforisms.words: Peace if possible, truth at all costs.
aforisms.author: Martin Luther

aforisms.words: The important thing is not what one is born with but what use one makes of that equipment.
aforisms.author: Alfred Adler

aforisms.words: I thought how unpleasant it is to be locked out; and I thought how it is worse, perhaps, to be locked in.
aforisms.author: Virginia Woolf

aforisms.words: Muddy water is best cleared by leaving it alone.
aforisms.author: Alan Watts

aforisms.words: A wise man will be master of his mind, a fool will be its slave.
aforisms.author: Publilius Syrus

aforisms.words: The significance of life is living.
aforisms.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

aforisms.words: When we have our body and mind in order, everything else will exist in the right place, in the right way.
aforisms.author: Shunryu Suzuki

aforisms.words: Failure is an option here. If things are not failing, you are not innovating enough.
aforisms.author: Elon Musk

aforisms.words: When you rise in the morning, form a resolution to make the day a happy one for a fellow creature.
aforisms.author: Sydney Smith

aforisms.words: Argue for your limitations and sure enough, they're yours.
aforisms.author: Richard Bach

aforisms.words: Instead of thinking outside the box, get rid of the box.
aforisms.author: Deepak Chopra

aforisms.words: Give out what you most want to come back.
aforisms.author: Robin Sharma

aforisms.words: Humans and prosperity never endure side by side for long.
aforisms.author: Herodotus

aforisms.words: Truth is like most opinions - best unexpressed.
aforisms.author: Kenneth Branagh

aforisms.words: As a matter of fact is an expression that precedes many an expression that isn't.
aforisms.author: Laurence J. Peter

aforisms.words: If I persist long enough I will win.
aforisms.author: Og Mandino

aforisms.words: Knowledge has to be improved, challenged, and increased constantly, or it vanishes.
aforisms.author: Peter Drucker

aforisms.words: Empty your mind, be formless.
aforisms.author: Bruce Lee

aforisms.words: By changing nothing, nothing changes.
aforisms.author: Celestine Chua

aforisms.words: By words the mind is winged.
aforisms.author: Aristophanes

aforisms.words: Love your enemies, for they tell you your faults.
aforisms.author: Benjamin Franklin

aforisms.words: Sometimes a change of perspective is all it takes to see the light.
aforisms.author: Dan Brown

aforisms.words: Become the kind of leader that people would follow voluntarily, even if you had no title or position.
aforisms.author: Brian Tracy

aforisms.words: Why do you stay in prison when the door is so wide open?
aforisms.author: Rumi

aforisms.words: Closing your eyes and listening to silence is self-care.
aforisms.author: Maxime Lagace

aforisms.words: All wealth is the product of labor.
aforisms.author: John Locke

aforisms.words: Distant water does not put out a nearby fire.
aforisms.author: Chinese Proverb

aforisms.words: Don't criticize what you can't understand.
aforisms.author: Bob Dylan

aforisms.words: The harder the conflict, the greater the triumph.
aforisms.author: George Washington

aforisms.words: Here is the test to find whether your mission on earth is finished. If you're alive, it isn't.
aforisms.author: Richard Bach

aforisms.words: You may forget with whom you laughed, but you will never forget with whom you wept.
aforisms.author: Kahlil Gibran

aforisms.words: Tall oaks grow from little acorns.
aforisms.author: Andrew Carnegie

aforisms.words: Never spend your money before you have earned it.
aforisms.author: Thomas Jefferson

aforisms.words: He who wishes to be obeyed must know how to command.
aforisms.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

aforisms.words: I pay attention to every minute of the day.
aforisms.author: Steve Harvey

aforisms.words: If you're not making mistakes, then you're not doing anything.
aforisms.author: John Wooden

aforisms.words: Never put off to tomorrow what you can do to-day.
aforisms.author: Thomas Jefferson

aforisms.words: When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.
aforisms.author: Zig Ziglar

aforisms.words: The truth is simple. If it was complicated, everyone would understand it.
aforisms.author: Walt Whitman

aforisms.words: We have to walk in a way that we only print peace and serenity on the Earth. Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.
aforisms.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

aforisms.words: The less you open your heart to others, the more your heart suffers.
aforisms.author: Deepak Chopra

aforisms.words: Failure is feedback. Learn from it and move on.
aforisms.author: Jack Butcher

aforisms.words: Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.
aforisms.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

aforisms.words: There are no differences but differences of degree between different degrees of difference and no difference.
aforisms.author: William James

aforisms.words: Time is more valuable than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.
aforisms.author: Jim Rohn

aforisms.words: The less you open your heart to others, the more your heart suffers.
aforisms.author: Deepak Chopra

aforisms.words: Life is to be fortified by many friendships. To love, and to be loved, is the greatest happiness of existence.
aforisms.author: Sydney Smith

aforisms.words: It's the unknown we fear when we look upon death and darkness, nothing more.
aforisms.author: Albus Dumbledore

aforisms.words: There is no significance in life without struggle.
aforisms.author: Lolly Daskal

aforisms.words: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
aforisms.author: Marcus Aurelius

aforisms.words: If you set your goals ridiculously high and its a failure, you will fail above everyone elses success.
aforisms.author: James Cameron

aforisms.words: Dance first. Think later. It's the natural order.
aforisms.author: Samuel Beckett

aforisms.words: Listening well is as powerful as talking well, and is also as essential to true conversation.
aforisms.author: Chinese Proverb

aforisms.words: Surrender to what is. Let go of what was. Have faith in what will be.
aforisms.author: Sonia Ricotti

aforisms.words: The time is always right to do what is right.
aforisms.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

aforisms.words: Nothing in this world is worth having or worth doing unless it means effort, pain, difficulty.
aforisms.author: Theodore Roosevelt

aforisms.words: Most of us will do anything to avoid facing ourselves.
aforisms.author: Lolly Daskal

aforisms.words: There is always risk, so learn to manage risk instead of avoiding it.
aforisms.author: Robert Kiyosaki

aforisms.words: Getting over a painful experience is much like crossing monkey bars. You have to let go at some point in order to move forward.
aforisms.author: Unknown

aforisms.words: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
aforisms.author: Ralph Marston

aforisms.words: The wisest men follow their own direction.
aforisms.author: Euripides

aforisms.words: The final mystery is oneself.
aforisms.author: Oscar Wilde

aforisms.words: Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.
aforisms.author: Charles Dickens

aforisms.words: A good character is the best tombstone. Carve your name on hearts, not on marble.
aforisms.author: Charles Spurgeon

aforisms.words: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
aforisms.author: Benjamin Franklin

aforisms.words: Do something to move yourself toward your major goal every day.
aforisms.author: Brian Tracy

aforisms.words: Most people do not really want freedom, because freedom involves responsibility, and most people are frightened of responsibility.
aforisms.author: Sigmund Freud

aforisms.words: People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.
aforisms.author: Brian Tracy

aforisms.words: He who cannot be a good follower cannot be a good leader.
aforisms.author: Aristotle

aforisms.words: No matter who you are, we're creatures of habit. The better your habits are, the better they will be in pressure situations.
aforisms.author: Wayne Gretzky

aforisms.words: The path is difficult to ensure worthiness. The lazy look elsewhere, The persevering find riches.
aforisms.author: Ming-Dao Deng

aforisms.words: It is our experiences that mold us into who we are...during times of adversity our true character will show.
aforisms.author: Unknown

aforisms.words: Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.
aforisms.author: Celestine Chua

aforisms.words: Where the willingness is great, the difficulties cannot be great.
aforisms.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

aforisms.words: You don't need to be better than anyone else, you just need to be better than you used to be.
aforisms.author: Wayne Dyer

aforisms.words: An approximate answer to the right question is worth a great deal more than a precise answer to the wrong question.
aforisms.author: John Tukey

aforisms.words: If you cannot understand something, then you have understood it incorrectly.
aforisms.author: Kabir

aforisms.words: Behind every cloud is another cloud.
aforisms.author: Judy Garland

aforisms.words: Treat every moment as your last. It is not preparation for something else.
aforisms.author: Shunryu Suzuki

aforisms.words: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.
aforisms.author: Mark Twain

aforisms.words: The more you trust yourself, the less you compare yourself to others.
aforisms.author: Roy T. Bennett

aforisms.words: Sometimes you will never know the value of something, until it becomes a memory.
aforisms.author: Dr. Seuss

aforisms.words: We become brave by doing brave acts.
aforisms.author: Aristotle

aforisms.words: You may forget with whom you laughed, but you will never forget with whom you wept.
aforisms.author: Kahlil Gibran

aforisms.words: It is not the knowing that is difficult, but the doing.
aforisms.author: Chinese Proverb

aforisms.words: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
aforisms.author: Marcus Aurelius

aforisms.words: All animals except man know that the principal business of life is to enjoy it.
aforisms.author: Samuel Butler

aforisms.words: Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things.
aforisms.author: Peter Drucker

aforisms.words: A person is only by the thoughts that he chooses.
aforisms.author: James Allen

aforisms.words: You live by what you thrill to, and there's the end of it.
aforisms.author: D. H. Lawrence

aforisms.words: To avoid criticism, do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing.
aforisms.author: Elbert Hubbard

aforisms.words: The world doesn't always give you want, but it often gives you what you need.
aforisms.author: Naval Ravikant

aforisms.words: Success is the child of drudgery and perseverance. It cannot be coaxed or bribed; pay the price and it is yours.
aforisms.author: Orison Swett Marden

aforisms.words: No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.
aforisms.author: James Allen

aforisms.words: He will win who knows when to fight and when not to fight.
aforisms.author: Sun Tzu

aforisms.words: If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude.
aforisms.author: Maya Angelou

aforisms.words: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
aforisms.author: George Eliot

aforisms.words: Forget mistakes. Forget failure. Forget everything except what you are going to do now and do it. Today is your lucky day!
aforisms.author: Og Mandino

aforisms.words: Human beings believe just as they breathe - in order to survive.
aforisms.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

aforisms.words: Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.
aforisms.author: Roy T. Bennett

aforisms.words: One never does wrong by doing right.
aforisms.author: Norman Vincent Peale

aforisms.words: Men are equal; it is not birth but virtue that makes the difference.
aforisms.author: Voltaire

aforisms.words: Imagination means nothing without doing.
aforisms.author: Charlie Chaplin

aforisms.words: You have within you right now, everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.
aforisms.author: Brian Tracy

aforisms.words: We must cultivate our garden.
aforisms.author: Voltaire

aforisms.words: Whatever your mind can conceive and believe, it can achieve.
aforisms.author: Napoleon Hill

aforisms.words: The question is not what you look at, but what you see.
aforisms.author: Henry David Thoreau

aforisms.words: Fear does not have any special power unless you empower it by submitting to it.
aforisms.author: Les Brown

aforisms.words: You don't need to be better than anyone else, you just need to be better than you used to be.
aforisms.author: Wayne Dyer

aforisms.words: A man with outward courage dares to die: a man with inner courage dares to live.
aforisms.author: Lao Tzu

aforisms.words: Some people are old at 18 and some are young at 90. Time is a concept that humans created.
aforisms.author: Yoko Ono

aforisms.words: True life is lived when tiny changes occur.
aforisms.author: Leo Tolstoy

aforisms.words: If you can't, you must. If you must, you can.
aforisms.author: Tony Robbins

aforisms.words: In order for you to be the BEST you can be for others, first you must be BEST for yourself.
aforisms.author: Jeffrey Gitomer

aforisms.words: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
aforisms.author: Jim Rohn

aforisms.words: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
aforisms.author: Lao Tzu

aforisms.words: You purchase pain with all that joy can give and die of nothing but a rage to live.
aforisms.author: Alexander Pope

aforisms.words: Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.
aforisms.author: Zhuangzi

aforisms.words: Dance first. Think later. It's the natural order.
aforisms.author: Samuel Beckett

aforisms.words: The future depends on what you do today.
aforisms.author: Mahatma Gandhi

aforisms.words: We must create our own world or we will die from inaction.
aforisms.author: Robert Greene

aforisms.words: The things I carry are my thoughts. That's it. They are the only weight. My thoughts determine whether I am free and light or burdened.
aforisms.author: Kamal Ravikant

aforisms.words: If you can't argue both sides, you can't argue.
aforisms.author: Jack Butcher

aforisms.words: Greatest success comes just one step beyond the point at which defeat overtakes you.
aforisms.author: Unknown

aforisms.words: Being in a good frame of mind helps keep one in the picture of health.
aforisms.author: Unknown

aforisms.words: Conflict cannot survive without your participation.
aforisms.author: Wayne Dyer

aforisms.words: Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, 'What's in it for me?'
aforisms.author: Brian Tracy

aforisms.words: Honor is the foundation of courage.
aforisms.author: Amelia Earhart

aforisms.words: It ain't where you start in life, it's where you end up, and what you did along the way.
aforisms.author: Colin Powell

aforisms.words: If you realize that you're the problem, then you can change yourself, learn something and grow wiser. Don't blame other people for your problems.
aforisms.author: Robert Kiyosaki

aforisms.words: Be polite to all, but intimate with few.
aforisms.author: Thomas Jefferson

aforisms.words: Far more crucial than what we know or do not know is what we do not want to know.
aforisms.author: Eric Hoffer

aforisms.words: The most tragic thing in the world is a man of genius who is not a man of honor.
aforisms.author: George Bernard Shaw

aforisms.words: You live by what you thrill to, and there's the end of it.
aforisms.author: D. H. Lawrence

aforisms.words: Love is not about possession. Love is about appreciation.
aforisms.author: Osho

aforisms.words: Science can flourish only in an atmosphere of free speech.
aforisms.author: Albert Einstein

aforisms.words: Small men think they are small; great men never know they are great.
aforisms.author: Chinese Proverb

aforisms.words: Today you are you, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is you-er than you.
aforisms.author: Dr. Seuss

aforisms.words: The river that flows in you also flows in me.
aforisms.author: Kabir

aforisms.words: The only way it gets better for you is when you get better. Better is not something you wish, it's something you become.
aforisms.author: Jim Rohn

aforisms.words: A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.
aforisms.author: Criss Jami

aforisms.words: Youth is happy because it has the ability to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
aforisms.author: Franz Kafka
